metadata.title: CVE-2017-5644 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Apache POI in versions prior to release 3.15 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via a specially crafted OOXML file, aka an XML Entity Expansion (XEE) attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-5644` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache-poi-java - 4.0.1-1~18.03
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libapache-poi-java package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.1-1~18.03').
